title: misleading hint for filter() predicates

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the [following code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=9bb00846a403d63e7aef374c311371d1): <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
struct Stuff {
    items: Vec<u32>,
}
impl Stuff {
    fn filter<P: FnMut(&u32) -> bool>(&self, predicate: P) {
        self.items.iter().filter(predicate);
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: expected a `FnMut<(&&u32,)>` closure, found `P`
 --> src/main.rs:6:34
  |
6 |         self.items.iter().filter(predicate);
  |                                  ^^^^^^^^^ expected an `FnMut<(&&u32,)>` closure, found `P`
  |
help: consider further restricting this bound
  |
5 |     fn filter<P: FnMut(&u32) -> bool + for<'r> std::ops::FnMut<(&'r &u32,)>>(&self, predicate: P) {
  |                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^


```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
  |
6 |         self.items.iter().filter(predicate);
  |                                  ^^^^^^^^^ expected an `FnMut<(&&u32,)>` closure, found `FnMut<(&u32,)>`
  |
help: change the trait bounds to match the expected type
  |
5 |     fn filter<P: FnMut(&&u32) -> bool  {
  |                        ^^^^^


```

further information: with a function (as opposed to method) the HRTB hint goes away but the `P` error is just as unhelpful as before:
```rust
fn filter<P: FnMut(&u32) -> bool>(predicate: P) {
    [1, 2].iter().filter(predicate);
}
```

leads to

```
2 |     [1, 2].iter().filter(predicate);
  |                          ^^^^^^^^^ expected an `FnMut<(&&{integer},)>` closure, found `P`
```
